avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, extensive wind slabs formed by Wednesday in all aspects. The avalanche prone locations are covered with new snow and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility. Even single persons can release avalanches in some places. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on wind-loaded slopes above approximately 2000 m. In very isolated cases they can be triggered in the weakly bonded old snow and reach large size. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger. Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for caution and restraint.
Individual loose snow avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On wind-loaded slopes an unfavourable avalanche situation will persist in some regions.

snowpackStructure.comment:
40 to 80 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last five days. The sometimes strong wind has transported some snow. Fresh snow and large quantities of wind-drifted snow of the last few days are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack.

In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions thus far only a little snow is lying.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche danger will decrease gradually.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind from westerly directions, wind slabs formed. They represent the main danger.
Wind slabs can in some places be released by people. This applies especially at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, especially in pass areas in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, especially on steep slopes.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow. The fresh wind slabs are small and in some cases prone to triggering.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last four days. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.

tendency.highlights: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the new snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last five days as well as the wind slabs are lying on top of a weakly bonded old snowpack. They represent the main danger. Single winter sport participants can release avalanches. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example. Additionally in some places avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach quite a large size especially on shady slopes. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for extensive experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
Caution is to be exercised in particular along the border with Switzerland and in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable).
avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are covered with new snow and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.

snowpackStructure.comment:
30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last five days. The strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the new snow.
